citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Evidence of mammalian pests was observed in two areas housing nonhuman primates. Within the enclosure containing
three lemurs, a live mouse and feces were observed on the floor of the indoor housing area. A slight accumulation of
rodent feces was also observed in the indoor area of the gibbon enclosure. The facility has bait stations and traps
throughout the park, but they do not appear to be effective in these animal areas.
Failure to maintain an effective program to control mammalian pests can have a negative impact on the the health of the
animals through the spread of disease by contamination of animal areas and feed.
The licensee must correct by implementing an effective pest control program in all animal areas.
Correct by: 05/19/2023.

The wire fencing material on the lower left side of the large cavy enclosure has detached causing the bottom of the fence
to curl inward. This has resulted in several of the wire ends projecting into the enclosure causing sharp points at the level
of the animals.
Failure to maintain enclosure fencing can result in sharp points which can cause injury to the animals.
Housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and contain them.
Correct by: 05/12/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.84(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Evidence of mammalian pests was observed in two areas housing nonhuman primates.  Within the enclosure containing 
three lemurs, a live mouse and feces were observed on the floor of the indoor housing area.  A slight accumulation of 
rodent feces was also observed in the indoor area of the gibbon enclosure.  The facility has bait stations and traps 
throughout the park, but they do not appear to be effective in these animal areas.   
Failure to maintain an effective program to control mammalian pests can have a negative impact on the the health of the 
animals through the spread of disease by contamination of animal areas and feed.  
The licensee must correct by implementing an effective pest control program in all animal areas. 
Correct by: 05/19/2023. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The wire fencing material on the lower left side of the large cavy enclosure has detached causing the bottom of the fence 
to curl inward.  This has resulted in several of the wire ends projecting into the enclosure causing sharp points at the level 
of the animals.   
Failure to maintain enclosure fencing can result in sharp points which can cause injury to the animals.

Housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and contain them.  
Correct by: 05/12/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
